page.title: 13INDUSTRIAL WASTE, KIRKCALDY
page.content: Within the vicinity of Kirkcaldy there are two areas of the landscape currently marred by the dumping of industrial waste. Three kilometres from Kirkcaldy on the south side of the A907 an area is being used to dump slag from Seafield Colliery.This black stony material makes the land appear dirty, however the plan is to eventually cover the slag with topsoil and return it to use as farming land. The second area lies just off the B923 to the west of Kinghorn Loch. This is a larger area, and the material dumped here is waste from the British Alcan alumina refinery in Burnt Island. This waste is bright red in colour and causes a scar on the landscape, for which it is very difficult to envisage any future solution. The approach roads are also covered in red dust.
